website_summaries.verdict: You pay a premium price for an alternative power source that adds convenience.
pros: When software is up-to-date, it functions beautifully through the app
cons: Installation can be difficult because of the placement of the Ethernet connection

customer_reviews.title: The Ring Doorbell we have been waiting for...
customer_reviews.text: The wired POE version of the Ring is finally the device to own. No more video cutouts, lockups, messing with WiFi. Running it off a POE+ port of a local Unifi switch make the device also super easy to remote manage. Made a custom ~45 degree mount with a Leviton Surface Mount Backbox and patched it all in to match the stucco and paint of the house. Best looking doorbell setup we ever had.
customer_reviews.author: DigitalFuture

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product, but the back end is slow
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good product, but the back end is slow. I have 200 Mbit internet with low latency and expect better response from a hard wired camera. "Live View" should be instant on the local network, but it appears to go to the Ring server for the feed. There is an unacceptable delay in the Ring server. Amazon fix this! You bought Ring there is no excuse for poor through put and response.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: I really like the Ring Elite and its capabilities and how it ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Ring Elite and its capabilities and how it looks with a cleaner look after installation. I do like that it can use POE, but I don't think that capability is worth the extra money above the cost of the PRO. Maybe an extra $50 but not the extra $250.
customer_reviews.author: Jd0912

customer_reviews.title: Works well but needs ongoing subscription
customer_reviews.text: Reliable, although it can take a while to load if you don't have a high speed data connection. To be the most useful, it requires a $30 annual subscription to load video to the cloud. Why can't it just upload to my iCloud storage? Because they can make more money off the subscription too... Also knocking off 1 star for their spammy customer service emails. 4 days in a row I have emails from help@ring.com referencing my Amazon review and that I "may have questions regarding our Ring Protect Plans." I don't have a question, I just don't like being forced to pay Ring for online storage when I already have perfectly good storage options already.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Kogachi

customer_reviews.title: Much Improved Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: REVIEW UPDATE: I was contacted by a Neighbor Advocate in Ring’s Community Support Team. I was pleasantly surprised by this contact after my initial disappointing customer service interaction. The Neighbor Advocate was obviously more knowledgeable of the product than the first representative, but more importantly he was empowered to address my issue. He discussed the matter with me and agreed to replace the unit altogether. Very happy that Ring and their Neighborhood Advocate made this right. ORIGINAL COMMENT - I purchased this unit less than two years ago and the plastic doorbell button has cracked. Just got off the phone with support and was told that the button is not replaceable and I’d have to purchase a new unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliability at last!
customer_reviews.text: I am a previous Ring Pro owner in a stucco home. Even though I had an access point within 20 feet, the connection was not reliable (50-80%). The Elite version answers all reliability issues when connected through POE. If your house is actually Ethernet wired to the Doorbell, the connection is much easier than Ring Pro. Kudos to Ring for a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: TJMax2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Device
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is POE and wish they would make all their cameras POE. We are building our home, so it was pretty easy to run the Ethernet cable. Otherwise it would be pretty difficult.
customer_reviews.author: David Perez

customer_reviews.title: Lots of install work but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Great video doorbell. Replaced my crappy August doorbell that would fail to connect 3/4 of the time. Good picture quality and fast to connect. Every now and then the app will glitch but WAY less any of the competitors. I would agree that all of the network cable is not needed. I ran cable from my server room to the doorbell, so that was a waste. I also installed this in brick, so the orange low voltage gang box was not needed. I used a metal gang box and construction adhesive after cutting a hole in my brick. It looks and works great. Glad I upgraded. Just wished the cost of recorded videos was a little lower.
customer_reviews.author: A Strick

customer_reviews.title: Ring Elite, POE works well
customer_reviews.text: Overall, pleased with Ring Elite. Our old door bell wiring already had ethernet which made set up very easy. Works very well with my Alexa and Echo Show. There is a delay if someone rings the bell and I am away and need to respond through the phone app. Also, I will probably pay for the monthly video storage; but I am disappointed that Ring charges "extra" if you add other ring cameras to your account. Otherwise, I would give 5 stars, instead of 4.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Best video doorbell on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 and I plan to install 3 more. This provides the best video that I have seen for a video doorbell. I used my Cisco Poe switch and my house was remodled with conduit to every door so pulling Cat5 was easy. The zone feature is awesome which allows you to define zones for motion. This allows you to ignore cars on the street. Setup was easy and I was done in under 2 minutes. Installation on the house was less than 10 minutes because I had conduit to the door. This is the most secure video doorbell on the market since I use cat5 and not Wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L.

customer_reviews.title: $500.00 Garbage, NOT WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: 🚨🚨Total garbage. It still depends on WiFi, I have excellent internet speed but when I connect to Live View, I get poor connection, motion picks up yeah when the person is at my door. Not worth the money people. Now I have a $500.00 brick in front of my door. I can’t remove it now because I did modification to my front door. Now I have to redo my front door to get that piece of garbage off my door. NOT WORTH THE MONEY 😡👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽👎🏽🚨 🚨
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, slow and short-lived.
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded to the Ring Elite from the Ring Pro hoping to reduce the time between the doorbell ringing and the time the you see who’s at the door in the app. Unfortunately, even with a wired Ethernet connection, it often takes forever to launch the app and get a picture. Also, after a year after being installed, our Ring Elite simply died and had to be replaced. Not impressive for a $500 + installation doorbell. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T

customer_reviews.title: Expensive. But I am quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive but very reliable. My original ring doorbell was too far from WiFi for reliable operation and it just didn't look right stuck on the door. I installed an outlet box and ran a CAT-5 cable to my network. Lots of work and quite expensive. But now my doorbell works every time. I'd do it again. My one complaint (and the reason for 4 stars) is the size of the device. It is a hard fit into the provided outlet box but once you figure it out, all is OK.
customer_reviews.author: JohnA

customer_reviews.title: Ring traps you into a subscription for inferior service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these $500 devices and deeply regret it because they cannot be integrated into a comprehensive security system (such as one using Blue Iris software). All of my other exterior cameras (which are much higher quality and cost $110 each) integrate into a unified system with NAS storage. But Amazon/Ring stick you with a $3 month charge to record Ring video to the cloud. I don't want my video in the Ring cloud! And I've already paid them $1,000 for these two crippled devices that are intended to trap you into a subscription model. It's really inferior compared to what is possible.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great product - notes for the self installer
customer_reviews.text: I happily removed a DoorBird unit to "upgrade" to this Ring device. We have two of them and two chimes. This unit is more difficult than the other units to install because of the control box behind it. You either need to chisel out a 2x3" opening or get a mounting box from Home Depot to put over the hole for wires. Once that problem is solved, this works great. The person detect feature helps to reduce cars setting off the alerts. It let's you know when someone walks up and talk to people when you are across the country. IT comes with a power source but a POE switch for the house will simplify things.
customer_reviews.author: Robert From NY

customer_reviews.title: $30 year subscription
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that the ring door bell will only store videos to ring.com which requires a $30 per year subscription. There is no way to save the video to a local server; there is no SD card on the device either. The video sent to ring.com is not encrypted and the physical security is minimal. Since this replaced a logitech (no longer supported) camera with an SD card and local file store, I'm a little disappointed but if this meets your needs the optical quality is good and the setup easy.
customer_reviews.author: Derek A Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Great, but severely overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you’d think this would come with a wedge, or that one would be available, but no. Other than that, it works great, but is severely over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: not worth the high price
customer_reviews.text: Look great with the beige cover as it matches my stucco finish well. The sound output and microphone isn’t great but as bad as most other products. It may be related to the nearby surfaces. One solid thing about this product is that because it is hard wired i can count on the video output remotely where as my other Ring device constantly has connection issues due to its distance from my WAP. It is terrible that you have to buy a subscription to view any video that is not live. If you miss a ring or visitor by a minute, there is no video to see who was there without paying for the subscription.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sarcona

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for two weeks
customer_reviews.text: It took us a while to schedule a professional installer to set it up. It worked great for two weeks, then quit. He came back today, checked all connections with his meter and had power everywhere except to the unit. It is dead, bad, does not work. A lot of money spent for something that is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love the picture. Poe is the only way to go. My only two reasons for not giving 5 stars is the inability to see anything but live videos unless you pay a monthly fee and the lack of an app for my TV so I can view it on the screen like a picture in picture.

customer_reviews.title: Great video doorbell
customer_reviews.text: We got this to replace a video doorbell that stopped working. The video quality is amazing. The microphone is so sensitive that we can hear people talking from across the street.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Worst product. I bought for the Poe option. Wanted faster connection and high quality. Sad to say spending all the extra money was a complete waist of money. This is the worst, least useful thing in my life. Everything is delayed and such a low quality we cannot use it ever. Don’t buy don’t buy.

customer_reviews.title: Works much better POE - cost not worth it to average american
customer_reviews.text: I like that the video is more fluid compared to the other because it was a lot more choppy. Didn't want to pay a couple hundred for someone else to install so constructed myself. When it comes down to they should drop the price. Would recommend waiting until Ring does drop the price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford it and the install price, get it.
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome. Quick to alert, always comes up on app and it take a Ethernet cable for utmost reliability. I’m a electrician, it doesn’t necessarily take a pro to install but it does take a handy person.
customer_reviews.author: Flectric

customer_reviews.title: Works great (PoE is a must), but a little expensive
customer_reviews.text: The only reason to buy this Elite Ring doorbell cam (over other Ring doorbell cams) is for PoE (otherwise, all other cams use wireless internet). But Ring has since come out with the Stick Up Cam Wired (2018 version), which also has PoE. So keep that in mind when selecting a cam. But no matter what, PoE (not wireless) IS the way to go. Super reliable and you avoid all wireless issues.
customer_reviews.author: A fair reviewer

customer_reviews.title: POE is everything
customer_reviews.text: POE = amazing instant connection to video feed and clear sharp video. Simple mount and run the RJ45 cord to unit and plug in the back. The App does the rest. If you have access where you can run the RJ45, it’s worth twice the cost and the unit sits flush and looks great!

customer_reviews.title: It works with the ethernet
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with the ring pro because my wifi would not work continuously. I bought the ring elite and it works with your internest. No problems anymore. It is more expensive and I needed someone to put in the ethernet cable but now it works.

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, POE, but poor video quality for high speed network.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this doorbell. The video clairity is far from what I expect from a hardwired connection. I am on my second unit as the first just stopped working, thankfully i was getting a new one anyways from Ring because there was feedback on the app end of a call. Sadly that feedback still exists on both my galaxy s8 and my windows 10 machines even on the new unit. The video is more compressed than expected. I have 1gbps internet on a high-end home LAN, so my network/internet are not the problem. Live view speed is very good usually. Other compaints are related to the app, Far too many clicks to get to the live view trigger.

product_meta.title: Ring Video Doorbell Elite
feature_bullets: Connect your Ring doorbell with Alexa to hear announcements on your compatible Echo device when your doorbell is pressed and see a live view of your camera if you have an Echo device with a screen. Talk to visitors by saying “Alexa, talk to the front door”
Lets you see, hear and speak to visitors from your phone, tablet and PC
Sends alerts as soon as motion is detected or when visitors press the Doorbell
Connects to ethernet cables for power and internet connection
Monitors your home in 1080HD video with infrared night vision
With a Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos.
Includes privacy features, such as customizable privacy zones and audio privacy, to focus only on what's relevant to you.
